question: In mice, do Ly6C^hi monocytes exhibit lower inflammatory capacity than Ly6C^lo monocytes, as measured by recruitment to inflamed tissues and inflammatory cytokine production? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Acute peritoneal inflammation recruited preferentially Ly-6C(lo) monocytes, and Ly-6C(high) cells were comparatively scarce and exhibited lower production of inflammatory cytokines upon ex vivo stimulation.
content.source_2: In addition, acute peritoneal inflammation recruited preferentially Ly-6C(med-high) monocytes.
content.source_3: Under chronic infection with Leishmania major, Ly-6C(high) monocytes displayed reduced inflammatory capacity relative to Ly-6C(lo) cells, with diminished TNF-alpha and IL-1beta secretion and weaker NF-kappaB target gene induction.
content.source_4: Under inflammatory conditions elicited either by acute infection with Listeria monocytogenes or chronic infection with Leishmania major, there was a significant increase in immature Ly-6C(high) monocytes, resembling the inflammatory left shift of granulocytes.
